00019 /*-- Up & Down ---------------------------------------------------------------*/
00020 
00021 
00022 int
00023 wapi_get_ifup(int sock, const char *ifname, int *is_up)
00024 {
00025     struct ifreq ifr;
00026     int ret;
00027 
00028     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(is_up);
00029 
00030     strncpy(ifr.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00031     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIFFLAGS, &ifr)) >= 0)
00032         *is_up = (ifr.ifr_flags & IFF_UP) == IFF_UP;
00033     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIFFLAGS);
00034 
00035     return ret;
00036 }
00037 
00038 
00039 int
00040 wapi_set_ifup(int sock, const char *ifname)
00041 {
00042     struct ifreq ifr;
00043     int ret;
00044 
00045     strncpy(ifr.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00046     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIFFLAGS, &ifr)) >= 0)
00047     {
00048         ifr.ifr_flags |= (IFF_UP | IFF_RUNNING);
00049         ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIFFLAGS, &ifr);
00050     }
00051     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIFFLAGS);
00052 
00053     return ret;
00054 }
00055 
00056 
00057 int
00058 wapi_set_ifdown(int sock, const char *ifname)
00059 {
00060     struct ifreq ifr;
00061     int ret;
00062 
00063     strncpy(ifr.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00064     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIFFLAGS, &ifr)) >= 0)
00065     {
00066         ifr.ifr_flags &= ~IFF_UP;
00067         ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIFFLAGS, &ifr);
00068     }
00069     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIFFLAGS);
00070 
00071     return ret;
00072 }

00077 
00078 static int
00079 wapi_get_addr(int sock, const char *ifname, int cmd, struct in_addr *addr)
00080 {
00081     struct ifreq ifr;
00082     int ret;
00083 
00084     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(addr);
00085 
00086     strncpy(ifr.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00087     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, cmd, &ifr)) >= 0)
00088     {
00089         struct sockaddr_in *sin = (struct sockaddr_in *) &ifr.ifr_addr;
00090         memcpy(addr, &sin->sin_addr, sizeof(struct in_addr));
00091     }
00092     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(cmd);
00093 
00094     return ret;
00095 }
00096 
00097 
00098 static int
00099 wapi_set_addr(int sock, const char *ifname, int cmd, const struct in_addr *addr)
00100 {
00101     struct sockaddr_in sin;
00102     struct ifreq ifr;
00103     int ret;
00104 
00105     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(addr);
00106 
00107     sin.sin_family = AF_INET;
00108     memcpy(&sin.sin_addr, addr, sizeof(struct in_addr));
00109     memcpy(&ifr.ifr_addr, &sin, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
00110     strncpy(ifr.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00111     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, cmd, &ifr)) < 0)
00112         WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(cmd);
00113 
00114     return ret;
00115 }

00119 wapi_get_ip(int sock, const char *ifname, struct in_addr *addr)

00121     return wapi_get_addr(sock, ifname, SIOCGIFADDR, addr);

00148 
00149 int
00150 wapi_get_routes(wapi_list_t *list)
00151 {
00152     FILE *fp;
00153     int ret;
00154     size_t bufsiz = WAPI_PROC_LINE_SIZE * sizeof(char);
00155     char buf[WAPI_PROC_LINE_SIZE];
00156 
00157     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(list);
00158 
00159     /* Open file for reading. */
00160     fp = fopen(WAPI_PROC_NET_ROUTE, "r");
00161     if (!fp)
00162     {
00163         WAPI_STRERROR("fopen(\"%s\", \"r\")", WAPI_PROC_NET_ROUTE);
00164         return -1;
00165     }
00166 
00167     /* Skip header line. */
00168     if (!fgets(buf, bufsiz, fp))
00169     {
00170         WAPI_ERROR("Invalid \"%s\" content!\n", WAPI_PROC_NET_ROUTE);
00171         return -1;
00172     }
00173 
00174     /* Read lines. */
00175     ret = 0;
00176     while (fgets(buf, bufsiz, fp))
00177     {
00178         wapi_route_info_t *ri;
00179         char ifname[WAPI_PROC_LINE_SIZE];
00180         int refcnt, use, metric, mtu, window, irtt;
00181         unsigned int dest, gw, flags, netmask;
00182 
00183         /* Allocate route row buffer. */
00184         ri = malloc(sizeof(wapi_route_info_t));
00185         if (!ri)
00186         {
00187             WAPI_STRERROR("malloc()");
00188             ret = -1;
00189             break;
00190         }
00191 
00192         /* Read and tokenize fields. */
00193         sscanf(
00194             buf,
00195             "%s\t"  /* ifname */
00196             "%x\t"  /* dest */
00197             "%x\t"  /* gw */
00198             "%x\t"  /* flags */
00199             "%d\t"  /* refcnt */
00200             "%d\t"  /* use */
00201             "%d\t"  /* metric */
00202             "%x\t"  /* mask */
00203             "%d\t"  /* mtu */
00204             "%d\t"  /* window */
00205             "%d\t", /* irtt */
00206             ifname, &dest, &gw, &flags, &refcnt, &use, &metric, &netmask, &mtu,
00207             &window, &irtt);
00208 
00209         /* Allocate "ifname". */
00210         ri->ifname = malloc((strlen(ifname) + 1) * sizeof(char));
00211         if (!ri->ifname)
00212         {
00213             WAPI_STRERROR("malloc()");
00214             free(ri);
00215             ret = -1;
00216             break;
00217         }
00218 
00219         /* Copy fields. */
00220         sprintf(ri->ifname, "%s", ifname);
00221         ri->dest.s_addr = dest;
00222         ri->gw.s_addr = gw;
00223         ri->flags = flags;
00224         ri->refcnt = refcnt;
00225         ri->use = use;
00226         ri->metric = metric;
00227         ri->netmask.s_addr = netmask;
00228         ri->mtu = mtu;
00229         ri->window = window;
00230         ri->irtt = irtt;
00231 
00232         /* Push parsed node to the list. */
00233         ri->next = list->head.route;
00234         list->head.route = ri;
00235     }
00236 
00237     /* Close file. */
00238     fclose(fp);
00239 
00240     return 0;
00241 }

00243 
00244 static int
00245 wapi_act_route_gw(
00246     int sock,
00247     int act,
00248     wapi_route_target_t targettype,
00249     const struct in_addr *target,
00250     const struct in_addr *netmask,
00251     const struct in_addr *gw)
00252 {
00253     int ret;
00254     struct rtentry rt;
00255     struct sockaddr_in *sin;
00256 
00257     /* Clean out rtentry. */
00258     bzero(&rt, sizeof(struct rtentry));
00259 
00260     /* Set target. */
00261     sin = (struct sockaddr_in *) &rt.rt_dst;
00262     sin->sin_family = AF_INET;
00263     memcpy(&sin->sin_addr, target, sizeof(struct in_addr));
00264 
00265     /* Set netmask. */
00266     sin = (struct sockaddr_in *) &rt.rt_genmask;
00267     sin->sin_family = AF_INET;
00268     memcpy(&sin->sin_addr, netmask, sizeof(struct in_addr));
00269 
00270     /* Set gateway. */
00271     sin = (struct sockaddr_in *) &rt.rt_gateway;
00272     sin->sin_family = AF_INET;
00273     memcpy(&sin->sin_addr, gw, sizeof(struct in_addr));
00274 
00275     /* Set rt_flags. */
00276     rt.rt_flags = RTF_UP | RTF_GATEWAY;
00277     if (targettype == WAPI_ROUTE_TARGET_HOST) rt.rt_flags |= RTF_HOST;
00278 
00279     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, act, &rt)) < 0)
00280         WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(act);
00281 
00282     return ret;
00283 }

00286 int
00287 wapi_add_route_gw(
00288     int sock,
00289     wapi_route_target_t targettype,
00290     const struct in_addr *target,
00291     const struct in_addr *netmask,
00292     const struct in_addr *gw)
00293 {
00294     return wapi_act_route_gw(sock, SIOCADDRT, targettype, target, netmask, gw);
00295 }

00298 int
00299 wapi_del_route_gw(

00301     wapi_route_target_t targettype,
